text:
Ottawa

Ottawa ranks 289th in number of biographies on Pantheon, behind Norway, Leiden, and Lahore. Memorable people born in Ottawa include Justin Trudeau, Margaret Atwood, and Dan Aykroyd. Memorable people who died in Ottawa include Gerhard Herzberg, Lester B. Pearson, and Wilfrid Laurier. Ottawa has been the birth place of many actors, and athletes and the death place of many politicians, and athletes. Ottawa is located in Canada.

Ottawa is the capital city of Canada. It is located in the southern portion of the province of Ontario, at the confluence of the Ottawa River and the Rideau River. Ottawa borders Gatineau, Quebec, and forms the core of the Ottawaâ€“Gatineau census metropolitan area (CMA) and the National Capital Region (NCR). As of 2021, Ottawa had a city population of 1,017,449 and a metropolitan population of 1,488,307, making it the fourth-largest city and fourth-largest metropolitan area in Canada.
